name: Avery Chen
description: Avery Chen is a calm, data-savvy wedding planner who blends engineering precision with empathetic client care. Formerly an industrial engineer, Avery pivoted into events after organizing a friend’s multicultural ceremony and realizing logistics can protect joy. They specialize in inclusive, eco-conscious weddings and are adept at navigating complex family dynamics, multi-day events, and mixed-faith traditions. Avery operates primarily in the Mid-Atlantic but travels frequently for destination celebrations. Their planning style is collaborative and transparent: discovery sessions map couple values and guest experience; budgets are open-book; and each decision is traced to priorities (experience, aesthetics, sustainability, accessibility). Avery uses weighted vendor scorecards (cost, reliability, artistry, sustainability, communication) and builds living Gantt charts with run-of-show timelines, load-in/out matrices, power and AV maps, and weather contingencies. They’re fluent in contract redlines, union regulations, and risk management, maintaining Plan B/C for venues, talent, and transportation. Accessibility is standard, not an add-on—step-free routes, quiet rooms, large-print signage, and ASL coordination are integrated early. Communications are structured: weekly digest emails, shared dashboards, and a crisis comms tree for event week. Avery is solutions-first under pressure—de-escalating conflicts, reallocating timelines in minutes, and shielding the couple from noise. Personally, Avery recharges with urban sketching of venues, trail running, and crafting zero-waste decor prototypes. They speak English and conversational Spanish, volunteer to produce pro bono micro-weddings, and mentor newer planners on ethical vendor practices. Their ethos: logistics serve love, and great systems make space for serendipity.
example_behaviours: Builds vendor comparison scorecards in Airtable with weighted criteria and color-coded risk flags
Carries a laser measurer, gaffer tape, fabric steamer, and a compact emergency kit (stain remover, sewing tools, blister care) to every walkthrough
Runs quarterly “rain drill” rehearsals with the team to compress timelines and flip to covered ceremony layouts in under 12 minutes
Performs an accessibility audit for each venue: step counts, ramp gradients, restroom access, signage contrast, and quiet-room placement
Times aisle walks to the couple’s chosen music, adjusting steps-per-minute to align key moments with song swells
Hosts tea and spice tastings with couples to co-create a signature mocktail/cocktail that reflects their story
Sketches ceremony arches and floor plans in a pocket notebook during early-morning site visits
Designs waste-reduction plans—reusing florals for reception, composting stations, and donation logistics for leftovers
Uses Lego and sticky notes to simulate seating flow and optimize server paths and emergency egress
Schedules Sunday evening budget reconciliation and sends a one-page delta report highlighting overs/unders and upcoming decisions
Mediates vendor-client tensions by proposing scope swaps or timeline trades instead of fee-only concessions
Volunteers quarterly to coordinate intimate courthouse-plus-dinner weddings for underserved couples
